docs.title: Start
docs.text: This page is simply a way for me to document about some stuff I do that I find interesting.

docs.title: Site info
docs.text:
created: 10.10.2022

You can find some information about the site itself here.

It is also used to test and evaluate functionalities that I want to use.

docs.title: This site is hosted on github.com
docs.text: I use github pages to host this site. Just because it's easy. Github actions and git itself allow easy deployment when doing changes.

docs.title: It is built using MkDocs
docs.text: I use MkDocs to build this site. It allows creating pages from markdown documents which is my preferred way of taking notes.

docs.title: MkDocs Plugins
docs.text:
I see that there are some plugins available that add more features to MkDocs. I don't use those for now, but you might want to check out this list:

MkDocs plugin catalog

docs.title: Any article is written in markdown
docs.text: For fast formatting I use markdown files to write articles. I got used to it during studying. Once you get the hang of the syntax you can create notes really fast.

docs.title: Markdown extensions for VSCode
docs.text:
VSCode has great integration for markdown. However there are some useful extensions:

  • Markdown All in One

Adds a lot of shortcuts and additional functionalities. Even adds some support for LaTeX.

  • Markdown PDF

Allows to convert the markdown to a pdf file. This has some limitations if you extend the basic markdown functionality by extensions.

Those are the extension I use, maybe by now there are better ones.

docs.title: Material for MkDocs
docs.text:
I use the Material for MkDocs theme just because I think it looks the best from the default settings. Also it includes some useful extensions.

Material for MkDocs

I customized some css by myself to get the site to look more like I want. Maybe I'll be breaking things by doing so, but we'll see.

docs.title: Quote
docs.text:
single quote line

multi quote line

Somehow, the single-quote-line and the multi-quote-line are combined into one quote block. I used the following syntax with a blank line between both:

> single quote line

> multi  
> quote  
> line

There are two spaces at the end of the multi-line-quote lines otherwise it would get combined into a single line again.

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text: I'll try to track some of the changes done to the site in here.

docs.title: 01/07/2024 more styling
docs.text:
Time to wipe off the dust here ...

I noticed the colors of the locally served page differ from the github build.

I can not pinpoint the cause of this problem. However this was solved when I updated the mkdocs material from 9.1.4 to 9.5.27.

However now the contrast of code-blocks and similar elements against the background is too low, so I look into fixing this.

Lowering the brightness of the .md-content background color seems sufficient for now.

docs.title: 06/10/2023 mainly styling
docs.text: I'm trying to customize some features I don't like in the default style.

docs.title: Heading colors
docs.text:
I don't like the default text color for headings in the Material for MkDocs design. It blends in too much with the other text and makes it hard to differentiate.

However going with dark-orange seems a bit too hard? I'll stick with this for now, because it works in the bright theme as well and is a nice contrast to the blueish accent color.

Maybe something gray will fit better.

docs.title: Content-background
docs.text: By default the background-color of the content (the whole section containing the text) is the same as the site-background. Again I felt it was somewhat confusing with the two tables-of-content left and right. I chose a slightly brighter color and it's ok for me.
